summary: Hey there. I am not sure if your requests are open but I am going to every Peter Parker fanfic writers to challenge them into...
question: Hey there. I am not sure if your requests are open but I am going to every Peter Parker fanfic writers to challenge them into doing a fanfic (or more) with representation for bisexual, asexual, aromantic and/or pansexual people. So, if you are up to this challenge, can I request a fanfic/blurb/headcanon with an lgbt!reader? Thank you very much. 🏳️‍🌈❤️
answer:
I can give it a try…

It wasn’t difficult or nerve wracking to come out to your boyfriend.

You knew Peter was accepting and the whole subject came up so naturally that it didn’t seem to be a big deal at all.

You’d just been honest with him from the start and didn’t lie when the two of you got to talking about your relationship experience. He had been a little surprised when you mentioned your past partner but got over it quickly and the two of you just kept talking like nothing had happened.

The way Peter saw you and treated you didn’t change at all after that, he was still the same, sweet, loving, amazing Boyfriend he’s always been and you knew you couldn’t have made a better choice or ended up with a more understanding person

summary: Chapter 1
title: Chapter 1
body:
Masterlist  |  Homecoming Masterlist  |  Series masterlist

~Two Months Later~

You and Peter stand in the center of the public transit bus on your way to school. Peter pulls out his phone and starts texting Happy. After three messages, he scrolls through all the messages. None with a response from Happy. You place your hand on top of his phone and lower it. “The more you text him, the less likely he is going to respond babe. Just wait patiently.”

“Alright.” He puts his phone up. “I’m waiting.”

The bus drops the two of you off at the gate outside of the school and you both walk in hand in hand. You both cross the street and Flash, one of the popular kids, almost hits you. “What’s up, Penis Parker?” He goes to drive off but stops. “Hey y/n.” He says, trying to flirt with you.

“Never gonna happen Flash. Move along.” You turn around and walk in with Peter.

“Rise and shine, Midtown Science and Technology.”

“Students, don’t forget about your homecoming tickets.”

“OMG! Peter, Homecoming is next week.” You say as you reach your’s and Peter’s lockers.

“Okay and?”

“Peter Benjamin Parker!” You exclaim.

“What?! What did I do?” Peter defensively says.

“You promised we’d go to Homecoming this year. And you haven’t even asked me yet.” You close your locker and lean against it.

“Well we’ve been busy with the Avengers and everything.” He lowers his voice when he says this.

“No, I’ve been busy with the Avengers.” You laugh.

“Don’t rub it in.”

“Babe you’re still a rookie.”

“I’ve been Spider-Man for 8 months now.” He whisper shouts. “I’m more than capable of saving the world.”

“Peter, it took my Dad months to let me join the Avengers. Give him time. He just wants you to get better so that way nothing bad happens.”

“I’m sorry.”

“It’s fine babe.” You say as Peter finishes emptying his bag.

Suddenly Ned come sup behind Peter scaring you. “Join me, and together we’ll build my new LEGO Death Star.”

Peter turns around. “What?”

“So lame.” The cheerleaders snicker. You move to jump the but Peter wraps an arm around your waist.

“That’s awesome. How many pieces?”

“Three thousand eight hundred and three.” Ned says.

“That’s insane.” Peter puts a note book into his locker and pulls out a different on and his laptop.

“I know. You wanna build it tonight? You can help, y/n.” Ned pleads.

“No, we can’t tonight. Y/n has work and I’ve got the Stark—”

Ned nods. “You always got that internship.” Ned looks at you. “And you have work. How do you two maintain your relationship? It’s like you never have time to see each other.”

“Ned you do realize I work for Stark Industries right?” You say as you three walk down the hallway.

“Wait no! Since when?” Ned freaks.

“Since like ever. I practically grew up around Tony Stark.”

“You are so lucky.” Ned says.

“And hey, maybe my internship will lead to an actual job with them.”

“That would be so sweet. He’d be all, ‘Good job on those spreadsheets, Peter. Here’s a gold coin.’” You and Peter look to Ned. “I don’t know how jobs work.”

“That’s exactly how they work.”

“Oh. Okay, well, I’ll knock out the basic bones of the Death Star at my place. Then I’ll come by afterwards.” As Ned talks, you kiss Peter on the check and run off to your friends.

“Hey Liz!”

“Hey girl.” Liz hugs you. “We’ve missed you. It’s so glad to have you back.”

“I’m happy to be back. So tell me, what have I missed.” The group starts walking away. Peter just stares off at Liz and you as you walk away. You turn towards him and wave. He smiles and waves back.

“That’d be great.” Peter says to Ned as the bell rings.

/\/\/\/\/\

“Okay, so how do we calculate linear acceleration between points A and B?” The teacher turns towards the class. “Flash?”

“It’s the product of sine of the angle and gravity divided by mass.”

“Nope.” Flash looks at her like she’s crazy.

“This is why he’s an alternate in Decathlon.” You say to your friend Grace.

“Peter.” You look up from your notes to see Peter watching Spider-Man videos on YouTube.

“Is he watching those videos again?” Grace asks you.

“Yes. I don’t get how he passes every class and never pays attention.”

Peter jolts up and looks at the teacher. “You still with us?”

“Uh. Yeah, yeah.” He closes his laptop and looks at the board. “Mass cancels out so it’s just gravity times sine.”

“Right.”

“Is it possible that internship is making him smarter?” Grace asks you.

“Highly doubt it.” You answer.

“See, Flash, being the fastest isn’t always the best if you are wrong.”

“You’re dead.” Flash says to Peter. Peter sits up a bit straighter and then turns to look at you, then the clock and you instantly know what he’s thinking about.

You looks back at you. “No.” You mouth and he just cheekily smiles and looks back at the front of the room.

/\/\/\/\/\

You and Peter sit next to each other in Chemistry. As the teacher talks abort Niels Bohr you see Peter flip a page in his notebook to the recipe for his web fluid. “Peter.” You scold him but he doesn’t listen and leans over to the side of the desk opening a drawer and mixing the chemicals. As everyone works on the assigned chemical Peter leaves you to work alone and stares at the clock. “Peter Parker. Help me with this.”

“Right, sorry Love.” He kisses your cheek and begins helping you.

/\/\/\/\/\

Liz hangs the homecoming poster up on the wall. “Did Liz get a new top?” Peter asks Ned.

“No. We’ve seen that before, but never with that skirt.” Ned says. “You should probably stop staring at Liz before y/n starts getting suspicious.”

“She’s not gonna know.” Peter scoffs.

“Are you going to tell her that you have a crush on her best friend. While your dating her! Peter this will get you murdered.”

“She won’t know. But I should stop staring before it gets creepy.”

“Too late.” Ned and Peter turn to see MJ at the table. “You guys are losers.”

“Then why do you sit with us?” Ned asks.

“Cause I don’t have any friends.”

“That’s not true Michelle and you know it.” You say walking past her and sitting in front of Peter. “Hey babe, Ned.”

“Hey y/n. So are you two going to the Homecoming dance?” Ned asks.

“I don’t know, are we Peter?” You ask looking at him.

“I did promise. Don’t worry you’ll get a proper ask.”

“Huh-huh. Anyways, Peter has Happy texted you?”

“No.”

“Then stop staring at the clock all class long okay. It’s getting annoying.”

“But…”

“What did I say earlier?” You ask him.

“Wait patiently.” He responds.

“Then wait. I know Happy. Life is gonna suck if you bother him. Also I’m leaving after decathlon practice. Tony called, has some legal stuff I have to handle.”

“You’re on a first name basis with Mr. Stark.” Ned freaks. You and Peter just laugh.

Taglist: (open)

@peter-spider-parker-man

“Since like ever. I practically grew up around Tony Stark.”

“You are so lucky.” Ned says.

“And hey, maybe my internship will lead to an actual job with them.”

“That would be so sweet. He’d be all, ‘Good job on those spreadsheets, Peter. Here’s a gold coin.’” You and Peter look to Ned. “I don’t know how jobs work.”

“That’s exactly how they work.”

“Oh. Okay, well, I’ll knock out the basic bones of the Death Star at my place. Then I’ll come by afterwards.” As Ned talks, you kiss Peter on the check and run off to your friends.

“Hey Liz!”

“Hey girl.” Liz hugs you. “We’ve missed you. It’s so glad to have you back.”

“I’m happy to be back. So tell me, what have I missed.” The group starts walking away. Peter just stares off at Liz and you as you walk away. You turn towards him and wave. He smiles and waves back.

“That’d be great.” Peter says to Ned as the bell rings.

/\/\/\/\/\

“Okay, so how do we calculate linear acceleration between points A and B?” The teacher turns towards the class. “Flash?”

“It’s the product of sine of the angle and gravity divided by mass.”

“Nope.” Flash looks at her like she’s crazy.

“This is why he’s an alternate in Decathlon.” You say to your friend Grace.

“Peter.” You look up from your notes to see Peter watching Spider-Man videos on YouTube.

“Is he watching those videos again?” Grace asks you.

“Yes. I don’t get how he passes every class and never pays attention.”

Peter jolts up and looks at the teacher. “You still with us?”

“Uh. Yeah, yeah.” He closes his laptop and looks at the board. “Mass cancels out so it’s just gravity times sine.”

“Right.”

“Is it possible that internship is making him smarter?” Grace asks you.

“Highly doubt it.” You answer.

“See, Flash, being the fastest isn’t always the best if you are wrong.”

“You’re dead.” Flash says to Peter. Peter sits up a bit straighter and then turns to look at you, then the clock and you instantly know what he’s thinking about.

You looks back at you. “No.” You mouth and he just cheekily smiles and looks back at the front of the room.

/\/\/\/\/\

You and Peter sit next to each other in Chemistry. As the teacher talks abort Niels Bohr you see Peter flip a page in his notebook to the recipe for his web fluid. “Peter.” You scold him but he doesn’t listen and leans over to the side of the desk opening a drawer and mixing the chemicals. As everyone works on the assigned chemical Peter leaves you to work alone and stares at the clock. “Peter Parker. Help me with this.”

“Right, sorry Love.” He kisses your cheek and begins helping you.

/\/\/\/\/\

Liz hangs the homecoming poster up on the wall. “Did Liz get a new top?” Peter asks Ned.

“No. We’ve seen that before, but never with that skirt.” Ned says. “You should probably stop staring at Liz before y/n starts getting suspicious.”

“She’s not gonna know.” Peter scoffs.

“Are you going to tell her that you have a crush on her best friend. While your dating her! Peter this will get you murdered.”

“She won’t know. But I should stop staring before it gets creepy.”

“Too late.” Ned and Peter turn to see MJ at the table. “You guys are losers.”

“Then why do you sit with us?” Ned asks.

“Cause I don’t have any friends.”

“That’s not true Michelle and you know it.” You say walking past her and sitting in front of Peter. “Hey babe, Ned.”

“Hey y/n. So are you two going to the Homecoming dance?” Ned asks.

“I don’t know, are we Peter?” You ask looking at him.

“I did promise. Don’t worry you’ll get a proper ask.”

“Huh-huh. Anyways, Peter has Happy texted you?”

“No.”

“Then stop staring at the clock all class long okay. It’s getting annoying.”

“But…”

“What did I say earlier?” You ask him.

“Wait patiently.” He responds.

“Then wait. I know Happy. Life is gonna suck if you bother him. Also I’m leaving after decathlon practice. Tony called, has some legal stuff I have to handle.”

“You’re on a first name basis with Mr. Stark.” Ned freaks. You and Peter just laugh.

Taglist: (open)

@peter-spider-parker-man
trail.content_abstract:
Masterlist  |  Homecoming Masterlist  |  Series masterlist

~Two Months Later~

You and Peter stand in the center of the public transit bus on your way to school. Peter pulls out his phone and starts texting Happy. After three messages, he scrolls through all the messages. None with a response from Happy. You place your hand on top of his phone and lower it. “The more you text him, the less likely he is going to respond babe. Just wait patiently.”

“Alright.” He puts his phone up. “I’m waiting.”

The bus drops the two of you off at the gate outside of the school and you both walk in hand in hand. You both cross the street and Flash, one of the popular kids, almost hits you. “What’s up, Penis Parker?” He goes to drive off but stops. “Hey y/n.” He says, trying to flirt with you.

“Never gonna happen Flash. Move along.” You turn around and walk in with Peter.

summary: what do you think Harley and Peter's favorite colors are? Do they clash? Do they fight about them??
question: what do you think Harley and Peter's favorite colors are? Do they clash? Do they fight about them??
answer:
ok you already know peter’s is 100% red because he idolizes people associated with red in his life SO much. Tony and his suit, May and her whole personality of love and caring, Cap (before that whole shit show) for his shield, and so on and so forth. Even himself. Well, not himself, Spider-Man, this person-this Character-that he’s created of who he want’s most to be, because whether he truly knows it or not, he sees himself and spidey as a lesser and a goal, but he’s already there.

and harley’s is…pink. I’m not kidding. Pink is the color of Abby; pink is the color of that limited edition watch that he gave tony, their connection;pink is love and home and safety; and most importantly (not) pink is the color than he spray painted the local high school bully’s car to spite him.

harley tries to tell peter that his favorite color is black like the edge lord he is, but… he’s a bad liar.

peter arguing with the truth of that statement usually results in peter upside down in harley’s face until they kiss or peter falls on his head.

do they clash? depends on the shade? ;)

summary: we all wear masks 🕷 peter parker .two.
title: we all wear masks 🕷 peter parker .two.
body:
SUMMARY; Y/N is falling for the friendly neighborhood Spiderman. Unrelated, her and that dork Peter do not get along. (enemies to lovers au)

PAIRING; peter parker x reader

WORDS; 2554

WARNING; reader being dumbdumb and short i’m so sorry

        Spiderman left you stranded behind him, feet still dangling from the edge of the roof and before you knew it his red and blue shadow had disappeared into the night. As you made your way back home, you checked the news–there was no robbery on fifth. 

You knew Spiderman was avoiding your question. You suspected it, but the night after when he didn’t even show–you knew it for sure. You crossed the line.
He was always very secretive, making sure you didn’t know anything about him–his name, his age, where he lived, where he trained, how he got his powers; he didn’t tell you anything. Sometimes you wondered if you even knew him, but then you ended up chuckling to yourself, the thought dismissed whenever you were able to predict what he was about to say next. In fact, you knew Spiderman better than you knew anyone else in this city, probably even better than you knew Liz. 

Sure, you didn’t know the dry details about him, but did that information really matter when you knew all the other things about him? Like, you knew he bit his lip when you made a horrible joke. You knew he had freckles. You guessed he had dark brown hair, because a strand of it peaked from underneath his mask when it was overgrown. You knew he lived somewhere in New York. You knew he was your age, because he never had to shave his face and because his voice gave it away. You knew you cared about him. More than words could say, and you knew not seeing him last night was torture beyond any other.

*

Unfortunately, it didn’t matter how much you tried ignoring Peter’s presence, it was impossible when Liz was still venting through her feelings to you and MJ. But that was alright. Besides, you got to finally voice your opinions on her ex boyfriend, although they were never that secret, and as you yelled about how stupid his hair looked half the time Liz rolled her eyes with her large smile sitting proudly on her dark skin. Then she wondered out loud, if she knew who she was–the girl who stole her boyfriend away from her. You offered Liz to find out who she was, then you offered to TP her house–which caused her to giggle–but she declined both, saying it didn’t matter anyway. It was in the past now. You admired Liz for her strength, and gave her a big hug, before the subject turned back to you. 

“So, MJ tells me you’ve been seeing someone?” She asked, laughter echoing in her eyes at the sight of your pink cheeks. 

“It’s complicated,” you let out, but that caused Liz to let out a sound fit for a girl ready to gossip and so you had to tell her. Or rather, you told her a version of the story. 

You met him in a park, that much was true. And you hit it off right away, both searching for the owners of the black and white corgi he found at said park. Then he offered to buy you a milkshake and it was blue and red and you talked all afternoon.

“Wait, what’s his name?” Liz pushed, and frightened you looked over at Michelle. She raised her brows as if to say ‘your call’, and your call was a lie. 

“Ian. He’s a junior as well,” you nodded to her, or to yourself, as your curly haired friend tried her hardest not to roll her eyes at your lie. 

“Aw, that’s so cute,” Liz gushed, brows high and smile wide, “and what does he look like?” 

“I don’t know,” you said quickly, too quickly, before adding, “cute!”

Liz asked a few more questions, ones you could answer–like when this started, and if you liked him, and if you considered him a gentlemen, and what his thoughts were on gender equality and if he was smart like you and all other things a best friend should be concerned about when her girl sets her sight on a guy. 

“It’s been… weird, the last couple of days,” you confessed slowly, not sure if you could exchange the details to support such a claim, but sure enough you needed to tell someone about it. 

“What happened?” Liz asked firmly, reminding you of a coach about to prepare the team’s next play. MJ’s eyes lit up slightly at the words, her eyebrow quirking upwards in what you knew meant curiosity from her. 

“I asked him something and he avoided me completely, and he hasn’t talked to me since,” you informed them. 

Liz’s eyes rolled comically slow before she mumbled, “boys. Peter used to do that to me all the time.” 

“I think all boys do that,” MJ said, defensively.  

Just then the bell rang through the cafeteria and it was the end of girl talk and the beginning of double Chemistry–just like that, with one simple switch. 

It was impossible to concentrate however, when MJ kept sending you funny looks during the lesson and it was even worse when you caught Peter’s brown eyes on you, too. You blamed it on the fact they were lab partners, and nosy Parker just kept looking back because she was looking back, but as your eyes followed their movements, it seemed they were writing notes back and forth to each other on the piece of paper placed between them. 

You let out a sigh–you were being paranoid over nothing. MJ and Peter were friends, for whatever reason, but you had no reason to believe they were talking about you. Why would they?


You’ve gotten used to the feeling of someone watching you, and almost like a sixth sense–you knew exactly where that someone was hanging from.
Twisting to your left, you brought your head into the canopy of buildings above you as you spotted a small blur of red and blur. 

A cluster of butterflies crawled into your stomach, making home in it as the widely beloved suit came into view. You didn’t realise how much you missed the sight, how safer you felt now that you saw him. Could you tell him that? Could you even talk to him, after you so blatantly crossed the line the last time you spoke?

Your hand, on its own accord, shot up into the sky as you waved at him. 

He didn’t wave back. 

You cursed yourself and the cluster of butterflies in your stomach as you turned around–feet pushing off the ground much faster than needed to, but you needed to get away from his sight as fast as humanly possible. Unfortunately, he was superhuman. 

With a soft thud, you bumped straight into Spiderman. 

“Walked right into my web,” he said, voice deeper than you remembered it to be. 

“You’re awful,” you joked, rolling your eyes as if that could stop the smile from spreading on your face. He didn’t hate you after all. “I thought you hated me.” 

“I know, I’m sorr–”

“No, please don’t. I overstepped,” you tried. 

“No, no, of course you didn’t!” He assured you quickly, gloved hand reaching for your forearm, “I know you’re only asking because you care about me and it makes sense that you’re curious. I mean, it’s flattering really when such a pretty girl wants to know things about you I just wasn’t sure how you would react if I told you so–” he rambled on and on, and it took everything in you not to push him into the closest alley and kiss the words right out of his mouth. But instead, you let him speak, words barely registering in your brain as you tried your hardest to calm down the cluster in your stomach. You didn’t even notice when your fingers interlocked around each other, but they did, and it was magical. It was all you wanted, to be next to him again. 

“You have that look in your eyes,” he said, nudging you out of your daze. 

“What look is that, spidey?” 

“The ‘I want to kiss him’ look,” he said, hand sneaking around your waist as he pulled you closer. “You wear it a lot.”   

“Is that so?” You smirked, and his free hand caught the edge of his mask as he inched it up–planting a soft kiss on your cheek. “That’s all I get?”

“You’ll get more after I buy you ice cream,” he announced, voice lighter all of a sudden. You realised something, about his voice, as his mask recloaked his pale skin. 

He altered it. 

He didn’t use to.

A small weight fell on your heart at the thought he put yet another shield up against you, and you weren’t sure if it was to protect you or him. Was he ashamed of who he was, was he scared that you’d find out the truth? Would it be so awful if you knew who he was underneath the mask? Because, well, you did know didn’t you?

You pushed it out of your thoughts, fingers wrapping tighter around his and the pair of you strolled to the nearest ice cream shop. It must’ve been a strange sight, a superhero’s arm wrapped around a girl, in the middle of a random street in New York City. But, New York has seen weirder things than that, you were sure. 

Not that it mattered to you–you were near him, you were holding him, and that’s all you cared about. Not what people thought and how weird you must’ve looked. 

After the ice cream was consumed and peppermint kisses exchanged, he moved his mask back down and coughed. 

“Yeah?” You prompted.

“MJ.” Your brows frowned together, urging him to speak up. “She’s my friend from midtown.” 

A deep breath in, you tried understanding what he said. Did MJ know Spiderman, all this time? Was she lying to? Did she know who he really was, underneath the mask?

“Oh, yeah, she’s a good friend of mine too.” 

“I know, she talks about you a lot. And she cares about you,” he nudged you, smile apparent even through his mechanically altered voice, “always makes sure I’m a gentlemen towards you.” 

“You talk, like, every day?” You asked timidly, not wanting to come off jealous but knowing, by the small dip in his white eyes, he heard it. 

“She’s one of my closest friends.” 

“And does she know…” you said, regretting it before the words even formed on your tongue–but you said it anyway. 

“She knows Ian, yeah,” he assured you, causing you to roll your eyes. They did tell each other everything. 

As Spiderman walked you home, he clued you in on all the things you missed in your seventy something hours apart–and you him. It was just like before your misguided question, and now you had an answer. An answer you didn’t want, if you thought about it–but all thought evaporated as he lifted his red mask one more time and kissed you, a kiss to make up for all seventy hours.

*

The next morning, you couldn’t help the jealousy in your bones. You knew you shouldn’t have thought about it–but for some reason, some crazy hormonal reason, you couldn’t help but think MJ was betraying you. She could’ve told you she knew him. She could send hints your way or she could warn you if you’re doing the wrong thing, but MJ didn’t do anything. She lived in silence with the knowledge that you were crushing on her masked best friend–whoever he was. Since when did MJ know anyone who didn’t go to Midtown? Where did they even meet?

You were too proud to ask her, a girl you knew since you were thirteen–and so you were left to wonder all through Math class who it was, and how he knew MJ, and you realised how crazy you were acting only when your pencil snapped in half.

“Y/N,” she called out to you as you rushed towards your locker. You opted to ignore her, thinking if you talked to her today you might burst and say the wrong thing, like you usually did. MJ was your best friend, and she knew you, and although you knew she was used to your outburst, you still deemed it unfair on her to be on the receiving end of one–and so you decided to slam your locker shut instead. 

“Come on, Y/N,” she tried again, “you’re honestly not talking to me because I didn’t tell you?”

“You know who he is, don’t you? Like, who it is beneath the mask,” you confirmed out loud, and MJ nodded slowly–as if scared of the air around her.

“I do, but I promised him I wouldn’t–”

“You kept judging me for seeing him, saying I know nothing about him,” 

“Yeah, because you don’t know who it is, Y/N,” she tried rationalizing, but the knife you imagined earlier in your back was becoming heavier with each passing word.

“You do, though. He’s good enough to be your best friend but not good enough for me to date him?”

“No, it’s nothing like that–”

“Tell me who it is, Michelle,” you begged of her. 

“That’s not fair, I can’t just give away his secrets,” 

“What if it really sucks not knowing, MJ? You’ll be helping me, your best friend, please,” you asked, desperate to know. Something about the fact Michelle knew him, in real life, made you second guess this whole secret identity thing. Michelle didn’t have a lot of friends, that much was obvious–and she liked it that way. So how, how, did she know someone like him? Were they really that close if you never even heard of a boy Michelle got along with? Or was the secret that unimportant that he could give it away with ease to anyone? 

And if it was the latter, if it truly didn’t matter to him that Michelle knew–why didn’t you? 

“Sometimes not knowing is better–”

“Come on,”

“You don’t always want to know the truth, Y/N,” she emphasized, making you stop. She knew something more, you were certain, and as her face dropped you whipped behind yourself–catching her line of sight.

 
Peter Parker. 

Peter Parker listening in to the whole conversation. 

Peter Parker looking guilty, and upset, and a quiver of fear in his chin. 

Peter Parker always poking his nose where it shouldn’t be. 

“Peter, what do you want?” You let out, shoulders falling as a small whine left your lips. “We’re having a private conversation here.”

“You’re yelling in the middle of the hallway,” he corrected you, and you shot Michelle a glare as if she was the camera and you were on The Office, before you turned back to him. 

“I’m Peter Parker, I never know when to respect people’s privacy and walk away,” you mocked him, voice raising higher as his teeth digged deeper into his thin lip. 

“You’re one to talk about respecting privacy,” he mumbled, before his eyes shot open and he looked over at Michelle, panic on his freckled face. 

“What did you say to me?” You demanded, and MJ grabbed your hand before the argument could derail any further. 


“Let’s go,” she pushed you towards the exit, before turning back to Peter and whispered, “this is why, it’s because you never watch what you say around her.”

                                                                                         three

🕷🕸🕷🕸🕷

“Wait, what’s his name?” Liz pushed, and frightened you looked over at Michelle. She raised her brows as if to say ‘your call’, and your call was a lie. 

“Ian. He’s a junior as well,” you nodded to her, or to yourself, as your curly haired friend tried her hardest not to roll her eyes at your lie. 

“Aw, that’s so cute,” Liz gushed, brows high and smile wide, “and what does he look like?” 

“I don’t know,” you said quickly, too quickly, before adding, “cute!”

Liz asked a few more questions, ones you could answer–like when this started, and if you liked him, and if you considered him a gentlemen, and what his thoughts were on gender equality and if he was smart like you and all other things a best friend should be concerned about when her girl sets her sight on a guy. 

“It’s been… weird, the last couple of days,” you confessed slowly, not sure if you could exchange the details to support such a claim, but sure enough you needed to tell someone about it. 

“What happened?” Liz asked firmly, reminding you of a coach about to prepare the team’s next play. MJ’s eyes lit up slightly at the words, her eyebrow quirking upwards in what you knew meant curiosity from her. 

“I asked him something and he avoided me completely, and he hasn’t talked to me since,” you informed them. 

Liz’s eyes rolled comically slow before she mumbled, “boys. Peter used to do that to me all the time.” 

“I think all boys do that,” MJ said, defensively.  

Just then the bell rang through the cafeteria and it was the end of girl talk and the beginning of double Chemistry–just like that, with one simple switch. 

It was impossible to concentrate however, when MJ kept sending you funny looks during the lesson and it was even worse when you caught Peter’s brown eyes on you, too. You blamed it on the fact they were lab partners, and nosy Parker just kept looking back because she was looking back, but as your eyes followed their movements, it seemed they were writing notes back and forth to each other on the piece of paper placed between them. 

You let out a sigh–you were being paranoid over nothing. MJ and Peter were friends, for whatever reason, but you had no reason to believe they were talking about you. Why would they?


You’ve gotten used to the feeling of someone watching you, and almost like a sixth sense–you knew exactly where that someone was hanging from.
Twisting to your left, you brought your head into the canopy of buildings above you as you spotted a small blur of red and blur. 

A cluster of butterflies crawled into your stomach, making home in it as the widely beloved suit came into view. You didn’t realise how much you missed the sight, how safer you felt now that you saw him. Could you tell him that? Could you even talk to him, after you so blatantly crossed the line the last time you spoke?

Your hand, on its own accord, shot up into the sky as you waved at him. 

He didn’t wave back. 

You cursed yourself and the cluster of butterflies in your stomach as you turned around–feet pushing off the ground much faster than needed to, but you needed to get away from his sight as fast as humanly possible. Unfortunately, he was superhuman. 

With a soft thud, you bumped straight into Spiderman. 

“Walked right into my web,” he said, voice deeper than you remembered it to be. 

“You’re awful,” you joked, rolling your eyes as if that could stop the smile from spreading on your face. He didn’t hate you after all. “I thought you hated me.” 

“I know, I’m sorr–”

“No, please don’t. I overstepped,” you tried. 

“No, no, of course you didn’t!” He assured you quickly, gloved hand reaching for your forearm, “I know you’re only asking because you care about me and it makes sense that you’re curious. I mean, it’s flattering really when such a pretty girl wants to know things about you I just wasn’t sure how you would react if I told you so–” he rambled on and on, and it took everything in you not to push him into the closest alley and kiss the words right out of his mouth. But instead, you let him speak, words barely registering in your brain as you tried your hardest to calm down the cluster in your stomach. You didn’t even notice when your fingers interlocked around each other, but they did, and it was magical. It was all you wanted, to be next to him again. 

“You have that look in your eyes,” he said, nudging you out of your daze. 

“What look is that, spidey?” 

“The ‘I want to kiss him’ look,” he said, hand sneaking around your waist as he pulled you closer. “You wear it a lot.”   

“Is that so?” You smirked, and his free hand caught the edge of his mask as he inched it up–planting a soft kiss on your cheek. “That’s all I get?”

“You’ll get more after I buy you ice cream,” he announced, voice lighter all of a sudden. You realised something, about his voice, as his mask recloaked his pale skin. 

He altered it. 

He didn’t use to.

A small weight fell on your heart at the thought he put yet another shield up against you, and you weren’t sure if it was to protect you or him. Was he ashamed of who he was, was he scared that you’d find out the truth? Would it be so awful if you knew who he was underneath the mask? Because, well, you did know didn’t you?

You pushed it out of your thoughts, fingers wrapping tighter around his and the pair of you strolled to the nearest ice cream shop. It must’ve been a strange sight, a superhero’s arm wrapped around a girl, in the middle of a random street in New York City. But, New York has seen weirder things than that, you were sure. 

Not that it mattered to you–you were near him, you were holding him, and that’s all you cared about. Not what people thought and how weird you must’ve looked. 

After the ice cream was consumed and peppermint kisses exchanged, he moved his mask back down and coughed. 

“Yeah?” You prompted.

“MJ.” Your brows frowned together, urging him to speak up. “She’s my friend from midtown.” 

A deep breath in, you tried understanding what he said. Did MJ know Spiderman, all this time? Was she lying to? Did she know who he really was, underneath the mask?

“Oh, yeah, she’s a good friend of mine too.” 

“I know, she talks about you a lot. And she cares about you,” he nudged you, smile apparent even through his mechanically altered voice, “always makes sure I’m a gentlemen towards you.” 

“You talk, like, every day?” You asked timidly, not wanting to come off jealous but knowing, by the small dip in his white eyes, he heard it. 

“She’s one of my closest friends.” 

“And does she know…” you said, regretting it before the words even formed on your tongue–but you said it anyway. 

“She knows Ian, yeah,” he assured you, causing you to roll your eyes. They did tell each other everything. 

As Spiderman walked you home, he clued you in on all the things you missed in your seventy something hours apart–and you him. It was just like before your misguided question, and now you had an answer. An answer you didn’t want, if you thought about it–but all thought evaporated as he lifted his red mask one more time and kissed you, a kiss to make up for all seventy hours.

*

The next morning, you couldn’t help the jealousy in your bones. You knew you shouldn’t have thought about it–but for some reason, some crazy hormonal reason, you couldn’t help but think MJ was betraying you. She could’ve told you she knew him. She could send hints your way or she could warn you if you’re doing the wrong thing, but MJ didn’t do anything. She lived in silence with the knowledge that you were crushing on her masked best friend–whoever he was. Since when did MJ know anyone who didn’t go to Midtown? Where did they even meet?

You were too proud to ask her, a girl you knew since you were thirteen–and so you were left to wonder all through Math class who it was, and how he knew MJ, and you realised how crazy you were acting only when your pencil snapped in half.

“Y/N,” she called out to you as you rushed towards your locker. You opted to ignore her, thinking if you talked to her today you might burst and say the wrong thing, like you usually did. MJ was your best friend, and she knew you, and although you knew she was used to your outburst, you still deemed it unfair on her to be on the receiving end of one–and so you decided to slam your locker shut instead. 

“Come on, Y/N,” she tried again, “you’re honestly not talking to me because I didn’t tell you?”

“You know who he is, don’t you? Like, who it is beneath the mask,” you confirmed out loud, and MJ nodded slowly–as if scared of the air around her.

“I do, but I promised him I wouldn’t–”

“You kept judging me for seeing him, saying I know nothing about him,” 

“Yeah, because you don’t know who it is, Y/N,” she tried rationalizing, but the knife you imagined earlier in your back was becoming heavier with each passing word.

“You do, though. He’s good enough to be your best friend but not good enough for me to date him?”

“No, it’s nothing like that–”

“Tell me who it is, Michelle,” you begged of her. 

“That’s not fair, I can’t just give away his secrets,” 

“What if it really sucks not knowing, MJ? You’ll be helping me, your best friend, please,” you asked, desperate to know. Something about the fact Michelle knew him, in real life, made you second guess this whole secret identity thing. Michelle didn’t have a lot of friends, that much was obvious–and she liked it that way. So how, how, did she know someone like him? Were they really that close if you never even heard of a boy Michelle got along with? Or was the secret that unimportant that he could give it away with ease to anyone? 

And if it was the latter, if it truly didn’t matter to him that Michelle knew–why didn’t you? 

“Sometimes not knowing is better–”

“Come on,”

“You don’t always want to know the truth, Y/N,” she emphasized, making you stop. She knew something more, you were certain, and as her face dropped you whipped behind yourself–catching her line of sight.

 
Peter Parker. 

Peter Parker listening in to the whole conversation. 

Peter Parker looking guilty, and upset, and a quiver of fear in his chin. 

Peter Parker always poking his nose where it shouldn’t be. 

“Peter, what do you want?” You let out, shoulders falling as a small whine left your lips. “We’re having a private conversation here.”

“You’re yelling in the middle of the hallway,” he corrected you, and you shot Michelle a glare as if she was the camera and you were on The Office, before you turned back to him. 

“I’m Peter Parker, I never know when to respect people’s privacy and walk away,” you mocked him, voice raising higher as his teeth digged deeper into his thin lip. 

“You’re one to talk about respecting privacy,” he mumbled, before his eyes shot open and he looked over at Michelle, panic on his freckled face. 

“What did you say to me?” You demanded, and MJ grabbed your hand before the argument could derail any further. 


“Let’s go,” she pushed you towards the exit, before turning back to Peter and whispered, “this is why, it’s because you never watch what you say around her.”

        Spiderman left you stranded behind him, feet still dangling from the edge of the roof and before you knew it his red and blue shadow had disappeared into the night. As you made your way back home, you checked the news–there was no robbery on fifth. 

You knew Spiderman was avoiding your question. You suspected it, but the night after when he didn’t even show–you knew it for sure. You crossed the line.
He was always very secretive, making sure you didn’t know anything about him–his name, his age, where he lived, where he trained, how he got his powers; he didn’t tell you anything. Sometimes you wondered if you even knew him, but then you ended up chuckling to yourself, the thought dismissed whenever you were able to predict what he was about to say next. In fact, you knew Spiderman better than you knew anyone else in this city, probably even better than you knew Liz. 

Sure, you didn’t know the dry details about him, but did that information really matter when you knew all the other things about him? Like, you knew he bit his lip when you made a horrible joke. You knew he had freckles. You guessed he had dark brown hair, because a strand of it peaked from underneath his mask when it was overgrown. You knew he lived somewhere in New York. You knew he was your age, because he never had to shave his face and because his voice gave it away. You knew you cared about him. More than words could say, and you knew not seeing him last night was torture beyond any other.

*

Unfortunately, it didn’t matter how much you tried ignoring Peter’s presence, it was impossible when Liz was still venting through her feelings to you and MJ. But that was alright. Besides, you got to finally voice your opinions on her ex boyfriend, although they were never that secret, and as you yelled about how stupid his hair looked half the time Liz rolled her eyes with her large smile sitting proudly on her dark skin. Then she wondered out loud, if she knew who she was–the girl who stole her boyfriend away from her. You offered Liz to find out who she was, then you offered to TP her house–which caused her to giggle–but she declined both, saying it didn’t matter anyway. It was in the past now. You admired Liz for her strength, and gave her a big hug, before the subject turned back to you. 

“So, MJ tells me you’ve been seeing someone?” She asked, laughter echoing in her eyes at the sight of your pink cheeks. 

“It’s complicated,” you let out, but that caused Liz to let out a sound fit for a girl ready to gossip and so you had to tell her. Or rather, you told her a version of the story. 

You met him in a park, that much was true. And you hit it off right away, both searching for the owners of the black and white corgi he found at said park. Then he offered to buy you a milkshake and it was blue and red and you talked all afternoon.

“Wait, what’s his name?” Liz pushed, and frightened you looked over at Michelle. She raised her brows as if to say ‘your call’, and your call was a lie. 

“Ian. He’s a junior as well,” you nodded to her, or to yourself, as your curly haired friend tried her hardest not to roll her eyes at your lie. 

“Aw, that’s so cute,” Liz gushed, brows high and smile wide, “and what does he look like?” 

“I don’t know,” you said quickly, too quickly, before adding, “cute!”

Liz asked a few more questions, ones you could answer–like when this started, and if you liked him, and if you considered him a gentlemen, and what his thoughts were on gender equality and if he was smart like you and all other things a best friend should be concerned about when her girl sets her sight on a guy. 

“It’s been… weird, the last couple of days,” you confessed slowly, not sure if you could exchange the details to support such a claim, but sure enough you needed to tell someone about it. 

“What happened?” Liz asked firmly, reminding you of a coach about to prepare the team’s next play. MJ’s eyes lit up slightly at the words, her eyebrow quirking upwards in what you knew meant curiosity from her. 

“I asked him something and he avoided me completely, and he hasn’t talked to me since,” you informed them. 

Liz’s eyes rolled comically slow before she mumbled, “boys. Peter used to do that to me all the time.” 

“I think all boys do that,” MJ said, defensively.  

Just then the bell rang through the cafeteria and it was the end of girl talk and the beginning of double Chemistry–just like that, with one simple switch. 

It was impossible to concentrate however, when MJ kept sending you funny looks during the lesson and it was even worse when you caught Peter’s brown eyes on you, too. You blamed it on the fact they were lab partners, and nosy Parker just kept looking back because she was looking back, but as your eyes followed their movements, it seemed they were writing notes back and forth to each other on the piece of paper placed between them. 

You let out a sigh–you were being paranoid over nothing. MJ and Peter were friends, for whatever reason, but you had no reason to believe they were talking about you. Why would they?


You’ve gotten used to the feeling of someone watching you, and almost like a sixth sense–you knew exactly where that someone was hanging from.
Twisting to your left, you brought your head into the canopy of buildings above you as you spotted a small blur of red and blur. 

A cluster of butterflies crawled into your stomach, making home in it as the widely beloved suit came into view. You didn’t realise how much you missed the sight, how safer you felt now that you saw him. Could you tell him that? Could you even talk to him, after you so blatantly crossed the line the last time you spoke?

Your hand, on its own accord, shot up into the sky as you waved at him. 

He didn’t wave back. 

You cursed yourself and the cluster of butterflies in your stomach as you turned around–feet pushing off the ground much faster than needed to, but you needed to get away from his sight as fast as humanly possible. Unfortunately, he was superhuman. 

With a soft thud, you bumped straight into Spiderman. 

“Walked right into my web,” he said, voice deeper than you remembered it to be. 

“You’re awful,” you joked, rolling your eyes as if that could stop the smile from spreading on your face. He didn’t hate you after all. “I thought you hated me.” 

“I know, I’m sorr–”

“No, please don’t. I overstepped,” you tried. 

“No, no, of course you didn’t!” He assured you quickly, gloved hand reaching for your forearm, “I know you’re only asking because you care about me and it makes sense that you’re curious. I mean, it’s flattering really when such a pretty girl wants to know things about you I just wasn’t sure how you would react if I told you so–” he rambled on and on, and it took everything in you not to push him into the closest alley and kiss the words right out of his mouth. But instead, you let him speak, words barely registering in your brain as you tried your hardest to calm down the cluster in your stomach. You didn’t even notice when your fingers interlocked around each other, but they did, and it was magical. It was all you wanted, to be next to him again. 

“You have that look in your eyes,” he said, nudging you out of your daze. 

“What look is that, spidey?” 

“The ‘I want to kiss him’ look,” he said, hand sneaking around your waist as he pulled you closer. “You wear it a lot.”   

“Is that so?” You smirked, and his free hand caught the edge of his mask as he inched it up–planting a soft kiss on your cheek. “That’s all I get?”

“You’ll get more after I buy you ice cream,” he announced, voice lighter all of a sudden. You realised something, about his voice, as his mask recloaked his pale skin. 

He altered it. 

He didn’t use to.

A small weight fell on your heart at the thought he put yet another shield up against you, and you weren’t sure if it was to protect you or him. Was he ashamed of who he was, was he scared that you’d find out the truth? Would it be so awful if you knew who he was underneath the mask? Because, well, you did know didn’t you?

You pushed it out of your thoughts, fingers wrapping tighter around his and the pair of you strolled to the nearest ice cream shop. It must’ve been a strange sight, a superhero’s arm wrapped around a girl, in the middle of a random street in New York City. But, New York has seen weirder things than that, you were sure. 

Not that it mattered to you–you were near him, you were holding him, and that’s all you cared about. Not what people thought and how weird you must’ve looked. 

After the ice cream was consumed and peppermint kisses exchanged, he moved his mask back down and coughed. 

“Yeah?” You prompted.

“MJ.” Your brows frowned together, urging him to speak up. “She’s my friend from midtown.” 

A deep breath in, you tried understanding what he said. Did MJ know Spiderman, all this time? Was she lying to? Did she know who he really was, underneath the mask?

“Oh, yeah, she’s a good friend of mine too.” 

“I know, she talks about you a lot. And she cares about you,” he nudged you, smile apparent even through his mechanically altered voice, “always makes sure I’m a gentlemen towards you.” 

“You talk, like, every day?” You asked timidly, not wanting to come off jealous but knowing, by the small dip in his white eyes, he heard it. 

“She’s one of my closest friends.” 

“And does she know…” you said, regretting it before the words even formed on your tongue–but you said it anyway. 

“She knows Ian, yeah,” he assured you, causing you to roll your eyes. They did tell each other everything. 

As Spiderman walked you home, he clued you in on all the things you missed in your seventy something hours apart–and you him. It was just like before your misguided question, and now you had an answer. An answer you didn’t want, if you thought about it–but all thought evaporated as he lifted his red mask one more time and kissed you, a kiss to make up for all seventy hours.

*

The next morning, you couldn’t help the jealousy in your bones. You knew you shouldn’t have thought about it–but for some reason, some crazy hormonal reason, you couldn’t help but think MJ was betraying you. She could’ve told you she knew him. She could send hints your way or she could warn you if you’re doing the wrong thing, but MJ didn’t do anything. She lived in silence with the knowledge that you were crushing on her masked best friend–whoever he was. Since when did MJ know anyone who didn’t go to Midtown? Where did they even meet?

You were too proud to ask her, a girl you knew since you were thirteen–and so you were left to wonder all through Math class who it was, and how he knew MJ, and you realised how crazy you were acting only when your pencil snapped in half.

“Y/N,” she called out to you as you rushed towards your locker. You opted to ignore her, thinking if you talked to her today you might burst and say the wrong thing, like you usually did. MJ was your best friend, and she knew you, and although you knew she was used to your outburst, you still deemed it unfair on her to be on the receiving end of one–and so you decided to slam your locker shut instead. 

“Come on, Y/N,” she tried again, “you’re honestly not talking to me because I didn’t tell you?”

“You know who he is, don’t you? Like, who it is beneath the mask,” you confirmed out loud, and MJ nodded slowly–as if scared of the air around her.

“I do, but I promised him I wouldn’t–”

“You kept judging me for seeing him, saying I know nothing about him,” 

“Yeah, because you don’t know who it is, Y/N,” she tried rationalizing, but the knife you imagined earlier in your back was becoming heavier with each passing word.

“You do, though. He’s good enough to be your best friend but not good enough for me to date him?”

“No, it’s nothing like that–”

“Tell me who it is, Michelle,” you begged of her. 

“That’s not fair, I can’t just give away his secrets,” 

“What if it really sucks not knowing, MJ? You’ll be helping me, your best friend, please,” you asked, desperate to know. Something about the fact Michelle knew him, in real life, made you second guess this whole secret identity thing. Michelle didn’t have a lot of friends, that much was obvious–and she liked it that way. So how, how, did she know someone like him? Were they really that close if you never even heard of a boy Michelle got along with? Or was the secret that unimportant that he could give it away with ease to anyone? 

And if it was the latter, if it truly didn’t matter to him that Michelle knew–why didn’t you? 

“Sometimes not knowing is better–”

“Come on,”

“You don’t always want to know the truth, Y/N,” she emphasized, making you stop. She knew something more, you were certain, and as her face dropped you whipped behind yourself–catching her line of sight.

 
Peter Parker. 

Peter Parker listening in to the whole conversation. 

Peter Parker looking guilty, and upset, and a quiver of fear in his chin. 

Peter Parker always poking his nose where it shouldn’t be. 

“Peter, what do you want?” You let out, shoulders falling as a small whine left your lips. “We’re having a private conversation here.”

“You’re yelling in the middle of the hallway,” he corrected you, and you shot Michelle a glare as if she was the camera and you were on The Office, before you turned back to him. 

“I’m Peter Parker, I never know when to respect people’s privacy and walk away,” you mocked him, voice raising higher as his teeth digged deeper into his thin lip. 

“You’re one to talk about respecting privacy,” he mumbled, before his eyes shot open and he looked over at Michelle, panic on his freckled face. 

“What did you say to me?” You demanded, and MJ grabbed your hand before the argument could derail any further. 


“Let’s go,” she pushed you towards the exit, before turning back to Peter and whispered, “this is why, it’s because you never watch what you say around her.”

                                                                                         three

summary: “That doesn’t explain why I found you nearly dead by the side of the road in the middle of the night!”
question: “That doesn’t explain why I found you nearly dead by the side of the road in the middle of the night!”
answer:
“But Mr. Stark…” Peter mumbles, teeth chattering.

“No. No buts! You could have frozen to death, Peter!” Tony argued.

“I had to. That cat would’ve drowned if I hadn’t rescued him!”

Tony sighed, this was going to be a long night.

summary: Homecoming Masterlist
title: Homecoming Masterlist
body:
COMPLETED

It’s been 2 months since the events of the Civil War. You and Peter are still happily together and attending Midtown School of Science and Technology. Now that you both know of the other’s superhero alter egos, you patrol the streets of New York together when you’re not at the Avengers Compound. because you never signed the Accords you are under strict surveillance to make sure you are doing nothing more than handle some lowkey robberies. Being a superhero wasn’t easy anymore. Bucky went into the cryo-freeze and Steve, Nat, Sam, Wanda, and Vision were all MIA. When alien tech – in the hands of villains – causes problems not only in New York but between you and Peter, you have to do everything you can to protects the city and the people you love while making sure your relationship doesn’t fall apart.

blog.name: askyourfavouriteotp
blog.title: Ask your OTP
blog.description:
This an ask blog where you can ask

WinterFalcon / Merthur / Spideypool /
ScarletVision / Matt x Foggy x Karen

whatever you wanna know!

Gifs are a mix of things found on the web and our own gifs, feel free to use them!

Please be respectful both to the ship and person answering while sending in your question

SCHEDULE
Monday - WinterFalcon (Marvel) questions answered by roshytsunami
Tuesday - Merthur (BBC) questions answered by rainbowanimation
Wednesday - Spideypool (Marvel) questions answered by nerdofthefreeeeandfandoms
Thursday - ScarletVision (Marvel) questions answered by jennareedus
Friday - Matt x Foggy x Karen (Daredevil) questions answered by nerdofthefreeeeandfandoms
Weekend - mod asks, sometimes some RPs and time for us to answer questions

Spideypool photo manip in the main photo by queensofwd, used with permission

summary: “Yeah, of course. Sometimes hugs can fix everything. Be yourself around them. You and your presence is more than enough. It...
body:
“Yeah, of course. Sometimes hugs can fix everything. Be yourself around them. You and your presence is more than enough. It means they aren’t alone and they’ve got someone. That’s something that’s helped me. And humor. Lots of humor. Do things together that are fun and do some things that they enjoy. Be their shoulder when they need someone to cry on, or be the person they can go to when they need to talk. Be there for them and do what you can. Follow their lead.”

“Don’t treat them like they’re different or a fragile flower. Treat them like you always have. Ask how they’re feeling, but don’t focus way too much on the cancer. Sometimes a distraction is needed and that’s perfectly alright. If they bring it up or ask to talk about what’s going on with treatment or feelings related to the cancer, that’s okay. All I can really give is don’t treat them like they’re different and let them know that you’re there for them. Let them know that they’re strong and are not alone.”

(I am so sorry this is being responded to so late, @vervada-stormrider :( I hope they’re okay!! Sending good thoughts and love to them and to you! – Carolyn)

summary: JuSt A nOrMaL tUtOrInG dAy part 48
title: JuSt A nOrMaL tUtOrInG dAy part 48
body:
The bitch is back! Spoiler alert the bitch is me! Thank you for putting up with me! Now have another part!

~

*They’re still in the hallway*

Peter: Forgive me father, for I have sinned

Tony: Peter for the last time, all I asked you was what happened at the party

Peter: I’m not telling

Gwen: I can tell!

Harry: Me too

Peter: Le gasp! You traitors!

Harry: He kissed me too

Peter: Harry shut up!!!!!

Clint: Wow kid how drunk where you?

Tony: YOU WERE DRUNK!?

Peter: I WAS TIPSY

Natasha: *Looking at the wall like it’s a camera* This house is a nightmare

M.J: I stan a 4th wall breaking queen, but no Peter was drunk off his marbles

Peter: No I wasn’t!

Gwen: Dude you started crying because Betty was being nice to you

Flash: You cried when I gave you a chocolate bar

M.J: You cried when someone spilled vodka on your sweater

Ned: Then you cried because I gave you my sweater

Peter: I don’t remember any of that!

Wanda: Please tell me you got all of that on video

M.J: Oh fuck yeah! I have it right here *pulls out her phone*

Peter: I’m going to yeet myself off a roof now

Tony: *Long sigh* Peter we’ve talked about this
